 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
BYPASS BLOCKS(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on
multiple Web pages. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
An e-commerce website includes a long list of filters prior to the search
results listing. A link above the list enables users to skip the filters and get
to the product results quickly. Iâ€™d like to know a little more
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/bypass-blocks.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
